extraction.query:
SELECT *
FROM
  PROP_INSTRUCTION
WHERE
  PROP_INSTRUCTION_SET_GID = 'CUSTOM'
ORDER BY
  PROP_SEQUENCE_NUM

SELECT *
FROM
  PROP_INSTRUCTION
WHERE
  PROP_INSTRUCTION_SET_GID = 'CUSTOM'
ORDER BY
  PROP_SEQUENCE_NUM

rows.DESCRIPTION: This property is used to specify the MapViewer URL which connects to the map services provided by Oracle Maps Cloud Service.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%By default, this property contains no values. Once you get the map license from Oracle Map Cloud Services, set this property to https://elocation.oracle.com/mapviewer.

This property is used to specify the Oracle Maps Cloud Service URL which connects to the map services provided by Oracle Maps Cloud Service.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%By default, this property contains no values. Once you get the map license from Oracle Map Cloud Services, set this property to https://elocation.oracle.com/elocation
This property is used to set the value of the EDE parameter HOST for OracleSpatial distance engine.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%The default value of the property is elocation.oracle.com

This property is used to set the EDE parameter PORT value for the Oracle Spatial Distance engine.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%By default, this property is set to 443 as the default protocol used will be HTTPS.
This property is used to set the value of the EDE parameter GEOCODE_SERVLET for OracleSpatial distance engine.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%The default value of the property is /geocoder/gcserver
The default value of the property is /routeserver_sa/servlet/RouteServerServlet for South America

With the change to OIC Gen3, the web service security policy is no longer exposed on the WSDL of the OIC web service that OTM integrates with. OTM has used this to generate the UsernameToken to pass credentials in the outbound XML.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%https://support.oracle.com/epmos/faces/DocumentDisplay?_afrLoop=26459365632392&parent=WIDGET_RECENTLY_VIEWED&sourceId=&id=3012864.1&_afrWindowMode=0&_adf.ctrl-state=uvm5bt0uz_110
set to on to be able to see changes to each database column.

otm:IMessageText = THE TRANSACTION CODE NP IS NOT SUPPORTED IN THIS INTERFACE. VALID CODES ARE Release.TransactionCode = I. Set glog.integration.compatibility=V21 in glog.properties to allow Changes to Release via Shipment Interface
Increase the Cache
Increase the Cache
Determines if it is necessary to notify services providers who took part in bidding, but not awarded the tender, for Spot Bid tender.
Determines if it is necessary to notify service providers who took part in bidding, but not awarded the tender, for broadcast tender.
Determines if service providers who did not participate in bidding receive notifications.
Limit de Export csv
Limit de retorno da consulta
Limit de registro na tela

Controls the number of records that are displayed after a search and the number of additional records that are displayed when you click the More link on a refreshed finder. This is defined according to the following hierarchy:%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%The Finder Page Size user preference.%%CR%%%%LF%%The glog.webserver.finder.page_size property.%%CR%%%%LF%%A default of 25.%%CR%%%%LF%%If this property is not defined, the default of 25 is used.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%Default: 25

This property enables finder results to be configurable so you can select which columns to display, and in what order, from a list of available columns. You can configure the columns by right-clicking on the column header and then selecting which columns to display. The options are TRUE and FALSE. The default value is TRUE meaning you are able to configure the results. In addition to this property being set to TRUE, you must have write access for the domain.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%Set this to false to prevent users from changing the results screen.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%To set this to false, you must first add the property.

Transportation and Global Trade Management Cloud provides functionality to automatically change text to upper case when processing the inbound XML. You can enable the functionality by setting the following property:%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%glog.integration.enableCaseChange=true%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%If there are some elements that you do not want to change, you can set the glog.integration.casechange.element property for those elements. Valid values are element names. For example, to prohibit the ArgName and ArgValue values from changing, you would define the following:%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%glog.integration.casechange.element=ArgName
Determines if preferred rates are displayed

This is used to enable the use of stylesheets based on the Language and Country defined in the User Preferences. For example, for the contact, the Language is set to Spanish, the Country is set to Mexico and the stylesheet then would be used for faxing is DefaultOrderEventText.xsl then the file DefaultOrderEventText_es_MX.xsl would be used instead.
If you want to send email notification triggered by changes to properties, use this property to specify the return address for property change notification emails.
Designates the default From Address for emails generated by the system.
Determines whether to turn on/off the tender timeout timer based on the response time for tender.
Determines whether to allow re-tendering on tender timeout.

Controls placement of the logo within the email message.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%options: [outside, aboveLeft, aboveCenter, aboveRight, belowLeft, belowCenter, belowRight, embedLeftTop, embedLeftCenter, embedLeftBottom, embedRightTop, embedRightCenter, embedRightBottom]

Within the Properties grid section, add a new property entry so Transportation and Global Trade Management Cloud knows your External System ID you configured for your Oracle Identity Cloud Service instance.%%CR%%%%LF%%Provide a Sequence number as the next number available.%%CR%%%%LF%%In the Instruction field, select Set.%%CR%%%%LF%%Enter a key of "glog.security.user.idcs.externalSystem".%%CR%%%%LF%%For the Value, enter the External System ID you configured for your Oracle Identity Cloud Service instance.

This property is used to specify the MapViewer URL which connects to the map services provided by Oracle Maps Cloud Service.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%By default, this property contains no values. Once you get the map license from Oracle Map Cloud Services, set this property to https://elocation.oracle.com/mapviewer.

This property is used to specify the Oracle Maps Cloud Service URL which connects to the map services provided by Oracle Maps Cloud Service.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%By default, this property contains no values. Once you get the map license from Oracle Map Cloud Services, set this property to https://elocation.oracle.com/elocation
This property is used to set the value of the EDE parameter HOST for OracleSpatial distance engine.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%The default value of the property is elocation.oracle.com

This property is used to set the EDE parameter PORT value for the Oracle Spatial Distance engine.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%By default, this property is set to 443 as the default protocol used will be HTTPS.
This property is used to set the value of the EDE parameter GEOCODE_SERVLET for OracleSpatial distance engine.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%The default value of the property is /geocoder/gcserver
The default value of the property is /routeserver_sa/servlet/RouteServerServlet for South America

With the change to OIC Gen3, the web service security policy is no longer exposed on the WSDL of the OIC web service that OTM integrates with. OTM has used this to generate the UsernameToken to pass credentials in the outbound XML.%%CR%%%%LF%%%%CR%%%%LF%%https://support.oracle.com/epmos/faces/DocumentDisplay?_afrLoop=26459365632392&parent=WIDGET_RECENTLY_VIEWED&sourceId=&id=3012864.1&_afrWindowMode=0&_adf.ctrl-state=uvm5bt0uz_110
